intro: Crepis stribrnyi, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive ribbed texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Crepis stribrnyi is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
